comment: Took him for intro class. Easy discussion boards and a paper. The exams were not that hard, as long as you read.

Took this class online and it is very note-heavy and on top, you have to read the textbook in order to pass the quizzes every week. On the bright side, there were only 2 papers throughout the semester, and graded them pretty easily.

The class itself was really easy. You definitely have to read the textbook to pass the weekly quizzes, but it's not difficult. He takes forever to grade assignments though and communication is nonexistent. I sent a couple emails throughout the semester and never heard back.

I took Professor Gurney for Criminal Investigation online. The quizzes are relatively easy as long as you review the powerpoint and vocal, it just takes weeks to get grades back. He is not the best at communicating. If you want an easy A then take this course, just keep in mind you won't have grades back for weeks at a time.

For multiple weeks he has not posted quizzes on time and then blames us when we email him late about it. Even if he posts quizzes late, he keeps the original due date (sometimes we have a day instead of a few). The syllabus said we would receive grades 6 days after the due date and we don't. Other than this the class is easy w/ no other problems
